definitions.title: Analogy
definitions.definition: An analogy is like a fun word puzzle! It compares two pairs of words to show how they are related.
definitions.explanation: A cat is related to a kitten the same way a dog is related to a puppy.

definitions.title: Antonym
definitions.definition: These are pairs of words that mean the opposite of each other.
definitions.explanation: Hot is the opposite of cold, just like happy is the opposite of sad.

definitions.title: Synonym
definitions.definition: These words mean the same or nearly the same thing.
definitions.explanation: Fast means the same as quick, just like small means the same as tiny.

definitions.title: Part-to-Whole
definitions.definition: This shows how one word is a part of something bigger.
definitions.explanation: A finger is part of a hand, just like a branch is part of a tree.

definitions.title: Cause-and-Effect
definitions.definition: One word is the reason, and the other is the result.
definitions.explanation: You study to learn, and rain can cause a flood.

definitions.title: Person-to-Place/Role/Specialization
definitions.definition: This shows a person and where they work or what they do.
definitions.explanation: A teacher works in a school, and a doctor works in a hospital.

definitions.title: Word Relationship
definitions.definition: This is the connection between the two words. Finding this link helps you solve the analogy!
definitions.example: Ask yourself, “How are these two words related?”

definitions.title: Pair of Words
definitions.definition: Two words that go together to make one side of the analogy.
definitions.explanation: The bird has a wing — that’s one pair!

definitions.title: Comparison Symbol (::)
definitions.definition: The double colon '::' means 'is to' or 'as.'
definitions.explanation: The sun shines in the day, just as the moon shines at night.

definitions.title: Reasoning through Relationships
definitions.definition: This is your thinking skill in action! It’s how you figure out what connects the words in each analogy.
definitions.example: Think: 'If the first pair goes together this way, how does the second pair match?'
